DataElement.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony._A 44-item self-administered questionnaire that assesses how well an individual can perform a specified task that utilizes physical mobility. Each is rated on a 5-point Likert scale from 1: Unable to do, to 5: Without any difficulty._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Each is rated on a 5-point Likert scale from 1: Unable to do, to 5: Without any difficulty.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient-Reported Outcomes Mea
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System® (PROMIS®) Item Bank v2.1 Mobility is a 44-item self-administered questionnaire, with items prompting on a scale from 15 how well an individual can perform a specified task.
